meanings.definition: A small piece or portion of something, especially bread.
meanings.sent1: I took a farle of bread from the loaf for my snack.
meanings.sent2: The baker handed out a farle of bread to each customer.
meanings.sent3: The little mouse nibbled on a farle of bread left on the table.
meanings.sent4: Her heart shattered into a farle of pieces when she heard the news.
meanings.sent5: The farle of sunlight peeking through the curtains warmed the room.

meanings.definition: To divide or distribute into small portions.
meanings.sent1: She likes to farle the cake into equal slices for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will farle the candies among the students.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to farle the soup into tiny cups for the party.
meanings.sent4: The music farled through the room, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent5: He farled his attention between the two interesting books.

meanings.definition: To break or tear into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: The child tried to farle the paper into tiny bits with his hands.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally farled the delicate fabric while sewing.
meanings.sent3: The wind farled the leaves off the tree in a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: His voice farled into a whisper as he shared the secret.
meanings.sent5: The storm farled the roof off the old barn in a fierce gust.
